alert.note: Alert for Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued October 06 at 1:34PM MST until October 06 at 2:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Southwestern Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... * Until 230 PM MST. * At 134 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Fortuna Foothills to 15 miles south of Araby to 24 miles south of Ligurta, moving west at 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 1 and 10. AZ Route 195 between mile markers 5 and 26. Locations impacted include... Yuma, Somerton, Gadsden, Fortuna Foothills, San Luis and Araby. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
